xyz.fsgik.common.convert.handlers

Class BeanConvertHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • handlers.convert.xyz.fsgek.common.BeanConvertHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FsConverter.Handler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProtobufBeanConvertHandler

    public class BeanConvertHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements FsConverter.Handler
    Convert handler implementation which is used to support the conversion for bean.

    This handler is system default suffix handler (with BeanConvertHandler()), any object will be seen as "bean", and the conversion means create new object and copy properties.

    It creates new Map for these target map types:

    • Map;
    • AbstractMap;
    • LinkedHashMap;
    • HashMap;
    • TreeMap;
    • ConcurrentMap;
    • ConcurrentHashMap;
    • Hashtable;
    • ConcurrentSkipListMap;
    For other types, it creates with their empty constructor.

    Note if the obj is null, return FsWrapper.empty().

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.lang.Object convert(@Nullable
                                                     @Nullable java.lang.Object source,
                                                     java.lang.reflect.Type sourceType,
                                                     java.lang.reflect.Type targetType,
                                                     FsConverter converter)
        Description copied from interface: FsConverter.Handler
        Converts object from source type to target type.

        In general, all handlers in the converter (FsConverter.getHandlers()) will be invoked this method sequentially. The result of this method in 4 types: null, FsFlag, FsWrapper and others.

        If this method returns null, means this handler can not do this conversion, and it will hand off to next handler; If this method returns an instance of FsFlag, means:

        • FsFlag.CONTINUE: same as null, means that this handler can not do this conversion, and it will hand off to next handler;
        • FsFlag.BREAK or FsFlag.RETURN: means that this handler can not do the conversion, and it will break out the handler chain. This will cause the conversion failure in this converter;
        • FsFlag.NULL or FsWrapper.empty(): means the result of this conversion is clearly null;
        • Other instance of FsFlag is a wrong result, will throw a FsConvertException.
        If this method returns a FsWrapper, wrapped object (from FsWrapper.get()) is actual result of conversion, including FsFlag, null and FsWrapper itself. Any other type of returned object is the actual result of conversion.
        Specified by:
        convert in interface FsConverter.Handler
        Parameters:
        source - source object
        sourceType - source type
        targetType - target type
        converter - converter to help convert unsupported part of object for this handler.
        Returns:
        converted object or null
